overview.title: Game Overview
overview.content:
KONIVRER (pronounced "Conjurer") is a strategic trading card game where players become powerful magic users called Conjurers. Build a deck representing your grimoire and battle to reduce your opponent's Life Cards to 0.

**Game Info:** 30â€“60 minutes â€¢ Ages 12+ â€¢ 2+ players
**Formats:** 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, free-for-all
**Components:** Element Flags, cards, optional dice for counters

**Victory Condition:** Reduce your opponent's Life Cards from 4 to 0 by dealing damage with Familiars.

setup.title: Setup & Game Zones
setup.content:
**Initial Setup:**
1. Place your Flag in the top left corner
2. Shuffle your 40-card deck and place it top right
3. Draw the top 4 cards face-down as your Life Cards (place below Flag)
4. Draw your starting hand (7 cards)

**Game Zones:**
â€¢ **Flag Zone** - Your elemental identity (top left)
â€¢ **Deck** - Your remaining cards (top right)
â€¢ **Life Cards** - 4 face-down cards that determine victory (below Flag)
â€¢ **Hand** - Cards you can play (in your hand)
â€¢ **Field** - Where Familiars are summoned and remain
â€¢ **Azoth Row** - Where resource cards are placed
â€¢ **Removed Zone** - Cards affected by Void abilities

deckBuilding.title: Deck Building
deckBuilding.content:
**Deck Construction Rules:**
â€¢ **1 Flag** - Determines your elemental identity (doesn't count toward deck size)
â€¢ **40 cards exactly** - No more, no less
â€¢ **1 copy maximum** - Only one copy of each card allowed
â€¢ **Rarity limits:**
  - 25 Common (ğŸœ ) cards maximum
  - 13 Uncommon (â˜½) cards maximum
  - 2 Rare (â˜‰) cards maximum

**Flag Benefits:**
Your Flag determines which elements you can use and provides bonus damage against opposing elements.

turnStructure.title: Turn Structure
turnStructure.content:
Each turn follows these phases in order:

**1. Start Phase**
â€¢ Draw 2 cards (first turn of the game only)
â€¢ Optionally place 1 card face-up as Azoth

**2. Main Phase**
â€¢ Play cards by resting (turning horizontal) Azoth to pay costs
â€¢ Summon Familiars, cast Spells, or place more Azoth

**3. Combat Phase**
â€¢ Attack with your Familiars
â€¢ Opponent may block with their Familiars
â€¢ Resolve damage

**4. Post-Combat Phase**
â€¢ Play additional cards if you have resources

**5. Refresh Phase**
â€¢ Refresh (turn vertical) all rested Azoth
â€¢ Pass turn to opponent

playingCards.title: Playing Cards
playingCards.content:
**Ways to Play Cards:**

**Summon (as Familiar):**
â€¢ Pay Azoth costs by resting Azoth cards
â€¢ Place on Field with +1 counters equal to âœ¡âƒ (Strength) paid
â€¢ Can attack and defend

**Cast (as Spell):**
â€¢ Pay Azoth costs, resolve ability immediately
â€¢ Card goes to bottom of your deck after use

**Place as Azoth:**
â€¢ Place any card face-up in Azoth Row as a resource
â€¢ Can be rested to pay for other cards

**Tribute:**
â€¢ Remove your own Familiars from the game to reduce costs

**Burst:**
â€¢ When drawn as damage from Life Cards, play for free
â€¢ Resolve ability immediately

combat.title: Combat
combat.content:
**Combat Steps:**

**1. Declare Attacks**
â€¢ Choose which Familiars attack
â€¢ Attacking Familiars rest (turn horizontal)

**2. Declare Blocks**
â€¢ Opponent may block with their Familiars
â€¢ Each attacking Familiar can be blocked by one defending Familiar

**3. Resolve Damage**
â€¢ Blocked attacks: Both Familiars take damage equal to opponent's Strength
â€¢ Unblocked attacks: Damage goes to opponent's Life Cards
â€¢ Remove Familiars with damage â‰¥ their Strength

**Damage to Life Cards:**
â€¢ Draw cards from Life Cards equal to damage taken
â€¢ If Burst ability, play immediately for free
â€¢ Otherwise, add to hand
â€¢ When all 4 Life Cards are gone, you lose
